pullRequest.body:
Transfer Riesz's theorem to manifolds: locally compact manifolds must be modelled on a finite-dimensional space. One direction already exists: `Manifold.locallyCompact_of_finiteDimensional`, and we provide a converse to it.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [5ace565c11](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19362/commits/5ace565c11263fa63f1867b97cad82f7aa047501)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ FiniteDimensional.of_locallyCompact_manifold`
`+ LocallyCompactSpace.of_locallyCompact_manifold`
`+ extChartAt_image_nhd_mem_nhds_of_mem_interior_range`
`+ extChartAt_target_union_compl_range_mem_nhds_of_mem`
`+ extend_image_nhd_mem_nhds_of_mem_interior_range`
`+ interior_extChartAt_target_nonempty`
`+ map_extend_nhds_of_mem_interior_range`
`- extChartAt_target_union_comp_range_mem_nhds_of_mem`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
`SmoothManifoldWithCorners.lean` is slowly ballooning. Perhaps it is due for a split.

> `SmoothManifoldWithCorners.lean` is slowly ballooning. Perhaps it is due for a split.

I think such a split would be welcome. (It could be worth waiting for e.g. #19296 to land first, to avoid conflicts.)

I took the liberty to address my remaining small comments myself. Looks good to me now, thanks!
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.

I'm not sure it makes sense to merge the result with the boundaryless assumption while the result without this assumption follows from essentially the same argument. So I've proved it without the assumption, and pushed to the branch. Feel free to revert whatever you don't like here!
I have edited the PR description accordingly. @winstonyin please speak up if you prefer not taking this change.
@grunweg, feel free to push directly to the branch: I haven't tried to do a full cleanup, so don't hesitate to improve anything!
Thanks for making these changes. Iâ€™m happy with them. Sorry I canâ€™t address these myself in the coming days.

I just made one clean-up pass over these changes. From my side, they're ready to go.
@sgouezel Do you see anything amiss/required before merging?

I'd move the deprecations to more proper places (see the two still open discussions above), but apart from that this looks good to me. I can't send it to bors, though, because I've written some code here. Once you're happy, you can maybe maintainer merge it again.

I moved one deprecation to its proper place. The other move is in fact moving a deprecation to a better place (i.e., fixes a pre-existing issue). All other deprecations in that file are placed right after the lemma they refer to. Hence, let me maintainer merge again:
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12064852112/job/33642452590)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12065382888/job/33644032856)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12065382888/job/33644032181)
Thanks a lot for pursuing my mini-project before I could get to it. I like the changes, and just have a few very minor comments.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Thanks. Looks good; I just have a question about generalisation to manifolds with boundary.

Sure, let's leave the generalisation for a follow-up. Sounds like a nice little project for me to take on :-) Let's get this PR in --- and good luck with writing your thesis! I know how strenuous it can be, but perhaps you can also enjoy it sometimes. :-)
Thanks a lot for pursuing my mini-project before I could get to it. I like the changes, and just have a few very minor comments.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

```suggestion
  `Manifold.locallyCompact_of_finiteDimensional`. -/

Let's add some docs:
```sugestion
/-- A locally compact manifold must be modelled on a locally compact space. -/
```

Can't you show this result for manifolds with boundary already? Just choose some interior point, and the same argument should work, right? (A new condition on `ModelWithCorners` ensures that interior points are dense, at least in the model space.)

Does `extChartAt_image_nhd_mem_nhds_of_boundaryless` require the interior to be open? It looks to me like it may not. (If it does, that's a fine reason to wait until a better theory of interior of a manifold is developed. I'm not convinced yet that's required, though.)
I wrote that at 4am. ðŸ˜¬ Let me look into this.

The more general fact that leads to this is: if a manifold `M` is non-empty, then its interior is non-empty, i.e. no boundary point can exist without interior points. I'm inclined to leave that and the generalisation of the current theorem as a TODO for a future PR.
PS: I'm unlikely to have time for mathlib in the coming month as I write my dissertation.

```suggestion

@[deprecated (since := "2024-11-26")] alias
extChartAt_target_union_comp_range_mem_nhds_of_mem := extChartAt_target_union_compl_range_mem_nhds_of_mem
```suggestion
```suggestion
```suggestion

```suggestion
extChartAt_target_union_comp_range_mem_nhds_of_mem := 
extChartAt_target_union_compl_range_mem_nhds_of_mem

**[lint-style (comment with "bot fix style" to have the bot commit all style suggestions)]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion extChartAt_target_union_comp_range_mem_nhds_of_mem := ```
This is a bug in the auto-suggestions. I'll add that to my list of things.

use dot notation?
```suggestion
  exact mem_of_superset (isOpen_interior.mem_nhds h'x) interior_subset
Very minor point: now you're putting the "interior" result after the boundaryless one; it was the other way around for the other two lemmas you inserted.
Is it worth extracting this `have` into its own lemma?
Is it worth inlining this have?

Use dot notation?
```suggestion
    hcom.image_of_continuousOn <| (continuousOn_extChartAt x).mono hss

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: locally compact manifolds are finite-dimensional
